page.title: 10GOVERNMENT - PARISH COUNCIL
page.content:
GREAT HORKESLEY PARISH COUNCIL
SEVEN MEMBERS WERE PRESENT AT THE LAST MONTHLY MEETING.IT WAS ANNOUNCED THAT MR STOWE OF LEAVENHEATH WAS NO LONGER AVAILABLE FOR SMALL JOBS,AND THE NOTICE BOARD AT THE HALF BUTT IS STILL FREE STANDING.MR RIX OFFERED TO REPAIR THE STRUCTURE AS SOON AS HARVESTING WAS FINISHED,PROBABLY IN NOVEMBER,AND THIS WAS GRATEFULLY ACCEPTED,NOTHING FURTHER HAD YET BEEN HEARD FROM THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL REGARDING THE TIDYING UP OF THE CHURCHYARD.IT WAS REALISED THAT THIS WAS A SENSITIVE MATTER,AND IT WAS AGREED THAT NOTHING WOULD BE DONE WHICH MIGHT UPSET THOSE CONCERNED.SOME WEEKS BEFORE A LETTER HAD BEEN RECIEVED FROM MR DICKERSON ABOUT TRAFFIC PROBLEMS IN IVY ROAD,AND THIS HAD BEEN FORWARDED TO THE BOROUGH ENGINEER
